sub_title: Operations Manager at The Seaweed Company
summary:
I am a highly motivated and driven individual with an Upper Division Second Class (2:1) BEng (Hons) degree in Mechanical Engineering from Manchester Metropolitan University, Manchester, UK. As a young Engineer, I have gained extensive experience working on various international projects, including seaweed cultivation systems in Indonesia and Ireland, as well as Anaerobic Digestion testing units in South Africa.

Moreover, I possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, as evidenced by my ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels, across diverse engineering backgrounds. Being bilingual further enhances my ability to work seamlessly with people from different cultures and backgrounds.

school.name: St George's British School of Malaga

profile_positions.description:
At The Seaweed Company we aim to capture the value of seaweed. We combine unique biological and technological expertise to integrate the seeding, growing, harvesting and processing of seaweed. As a result we are able to cultivate certified seaweed at open sea, and produce seaweed in the quantities needed to fully benefit from commercial CO2-reducing applications. 

Without using any land, fresh water, or fertiliser.

Our approach is to build solid business models that ignite vital ecosystems, with positive financial, ecological and social impact.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Kieran's main role for the Inrada Group is as a R&D / Project Engineer for Seatech Energy, he has also been involved with other members of the group, including InCharge and Inrada Oil & Gas. For further information on his activities and roles, please see below: 

•	Kieran's initial work for Seatech Energy required him to stay in Cape Town, South Africa for 8 months in 2017. Here he was involved in learning and researching the operational procedures for an anaerobic digester. This was an amazing learning experience allowing him to gain a good understanding in the development and installation of this technology in addition to expanding his bio-chemical knowledge of the procedures and parameters that allow certain feedstocks to be converted into Bio-Gas.
 
•	Another project for Seatech Energy allowed him to develop his design and CAD skills through a project engineer role, involving the design and installation of floating platforms for seaweed cultivation in Makassar, South Sulawesi, Indonesia. In addition to the engineering side of the project he was able to work very closely with the project manager and further develop his skills in this area.  

•	In addition to the Seatech Energy Projects, Kieran was also involved in designing PCB casing for another company within the group (InCharge). 

•	His work also lead him to being included in the early stages of a new product for the Oil and Gas Sector of the company (Inrada Oil and Gas) which involved  electrically powered actuators on a fail safe valve.
profile_positions.title: Research And Development Engineer
